text: Flora MacNeil, MBE (1928 - 16 May 2015) was a Scottish Gaelic singer. MacNeil was born in 1928 on the island of Barra. She was known for signing Mo Run Geal Og (“My Fair Young Love”), one of the greatest of the Orain Mor, or “Big Songs”. She was known as the "Queen of Gaelic singers". MacNeil died after a short-illness, aged 86. ==References== Category:1928 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Scottish singers
title: Flora MacNeil
